com.estimote.mgmtsdk.feature.bulk_updater

Class BulkUpdaterBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.estimote.mgmtsdk.feature.bulk_updater.BulkUpdaterBuilder

  • public class BulkUpdaterBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
    Builder class for BulkUpdater concrete implementations. You can configure here how your bulk updater should behave. Please remember that if you want to change those settings in a future, you will need to build a new object. "Don't let your device's pending_settings be pending settings. Yesterday you said tomorrow, So just do it. Yes you can! " - Shia LeBeacon
    Author:
    Pawel Dylag (pawel.dylag@estimote.com)

    • Constructor Detail

      • BulkUpdaterBuilder

        public BulkUpdaterBuilder(android.content.Context context)
        Public constructor for BulkUpdater concrete object. You should configure it's behaviour here and utilize built object.
        Parameters:
        context - app context needed for establishing connection to scanned devices.

    • Method Detail

      • withFirmwareUpdate

        public BulkUpdaterBuilder withFirmwareUpdate()
        Allows bulk updater to update firmware of devices. This feature is disabled by default.
        Returns:

      • withRetryCount

        public BulkUpdaterBuilder withRetryCount(int retryCount)
        Specifies how many retries should BU take to update each device. After N unsuccessful attempts, the device status will be reported as Status.FAILED. Default value is 1.
        Parameters:
        retryCount - number of retries
        Returns:

      • withTimeout

        public BulkUpdaterBuilder withTimeout(long timeoutMillis)
        Sets time after bulk uopdater should end it's job. It will simply destroy updating and fetching data. If the value is 0, the process will run constantly (forever and ever, for how long your battery can last)
        Parameters:
        timeoutMillis - timeout in milliseconds
        Returns:

      • withCloudFetchInterval

        public BulkUpdaterBuilder withCloudFetchInterval(long interval,
                                                 java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
        Sets how often should bulk updater sync data from cloud. The shorter this interval is, the quicker devices will be updated as soon as they got new pending settings in cloud. Default value is 5 seconds (5000 millis).

      • build

        public BulkUpdater build()
        If you are done configuring the bulk updater, use this method to construct concrete object.
        Returns:
